reviewText: I bought this movie out of curiosity and because I am a Rex Smith fan. He wasn't that bad as far as his acting goes, his music was the best part of the movie. I really enjoyed listening to him sing Always Saying Goodbye. Wonder if that song is available anywhere? If you are a Rex Smith fan you will want to add this to your collection. He is sexy rexy in this.

I have adored Rex Smith since I was 9 yrs. old and i got my first glance at him at the play "Grease".
He seemed to have disappeared from the late 70's early 80's limelight, and did this terrible harlequin romance book on film in 1992.  I haven't seen every single movie of his, but I am sure this has to be one of his worst film choices.
The only part I liked was him, his singing, and his moves.  He is a very sexy sultry singer and he isn't a bad actor.  When paired up with the "ballerina" his acting looks brilliant in comparision to her wooden performance.
I am on a quest to see as much of Rex's work as I can find, and well, this was one I won't watch again.  It was terribly acted, and I am sure he wasn't in right mind when he chose this role.
It's a curiousity Rex piece at best for his fans, who have remained and will remain forever his...
